cover.title: TorontoMapleLeafs
cover.body: The Toronto Maple Leafs (formally the Toronto Maple Leaf Hockey Club) are a professional ice hockey team headquartered in Toronto. They are a member of the Atlantic Division of the Eastern Conference of the National Hockey League (NHL). Maple Leaf Sports and Entertainment, which owns numerous professional sports teams in the city, owns the club. The broadcasting rights for the Maple Leafs are divided between BCE Inc. and Rogers Communications. Before moving to Maple Leaf Gardens in 1931, the club played its home games at Mutual Street Arena for the first 14 seasons. In February 1999, the Maple Leafs moved to their current home, Scotiabank Arena (formerly known as Air Canada Centre).
